result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamont M Magee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 91 days time served.
Concurrent with: with Case 11CF578 and any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain AODA assessment and Driver's Safety Plan and successfully complete follow-up treatment. Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.
No drug dealing or association with drug community (drug users/dealers or drug houses). No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent. Pay all supervision fees; Court ordered restitution set at $0 (zero).
Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time school and part time employment.

Provide DNA sample; pay surcharge. Pay victim/witness surcharge, fees, assessments, surcharges,and all other mandatory costs. Pay a fine of $600.00 including all applicable mandatory surcharges including DNA, PLUS a $50.00 surcharge for the Ignition Interlock Device be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving first 15 months of this sentence.
To commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamont M Magee

DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 21, Judge Brash.  jm
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: submitted on behalf of the defendant from Latisha R, received and filed.

Attorney Anne A Devitt in court, defendant Lamont M Magee not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared via telephone for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Defense in receipt of offer.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Anne A Devitt in court, defendant Lamont M Magee not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in negotiations.  Parties awaiting results of the blood test.  Status conference scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lamont M Magee in court with Imran Kurder, student intern under the supervison of Alexis Liggins for attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Lamont M Magee in custody.  Dennis Murphy for Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case was originally calendared for January 28, 2014. Courthouse complex was closed, case heard today.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  Court ordered SCRAM.    No driving without a valid license.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Lamont M Magee in court with attorney Mary D Scholle.  Defendant Lamont M Magee in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
